slidelink.displaytext: Searching Using the Team Content Folder

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
Welcome to the UCPath training on the Cognos Report system.

We will cover the topics displayed on this screen.

You can jump to a specific section of this module by clicking the menu link at the top left of the screen to open then menu, and then selectg the slide you would like to view.

If you wish to view the closed captions for this training module, click the speech bubble icon at the bottom of the player.

We have added files relevant to this training under the Resources link.

If you'd like to take notes, please download and print this Course Companion.

At times during this training, we may ask you to click an object on the screen to trigger an action, or click the next button to advance the course.

Click next when you are ready to get started.

In this module,we will cover the basics of the Cognos Reporting Tool.

Cognos is an IBM tool the enables UC Davis to provide reports from UCPath system.
Cognos is a web-based application that you access via your favorite browser, such as Internet Explorer, Chrome or Firefox.

To access the Cognos system, open your browser, and then go to ucpath.ucdavis.edu.

Click on quick links at the top right of the screen.

Once you are on the Cognos screen, please enter your usual network username and password, and click sign in.

This is your Cognos homepage. We’ll start with the Navigation Panel.

which is located on the left side of the screen.

The Home button returns to this page.

The Search button allows you to search for reports using keywords, such as part to the report title.

My content holds your saved reports, so you can easily access reports that are relevant to you.

Team content shows all reports that are available to you. The UCPath reports are organized by categories that you can browse by topic area.

The Recently Viewed button, which looks like a clock, displays the reports that you most recently accessed.
The area highlighted in yellow is the main stage where the reports are displayed.

If you have multiple report views open, you can switch between the reports on the Welcome drop-down menu.

Expand the Welcome menu, then select the report you want to view.

You can also close reports or return to the home page from the Welcome menu.

Depending on your settings, teal dots may appear on your home page.

These dots represent hints or tips for using Cognos Reports.

You can disable these hints in your Cognos preferences.

Now let’s take a closer look at the Team Content function.

This folder contains a variety of reports.

Please notice that your Cognos security may not grant access to all reports.

Your list may be different than the example shown in this training.

Observe there is a folder titled UCPath Reporting, click to view the reports.

Please note that we are using this folder for training purposes, you may see something slightly different in the production Cognos system.

Once you’ve clicked are into the main folder, the available reports are divided into sub-folders by category.

Click a folder to view the reports that it holds.
A list of reports is displayed on the screen.
You can resize the navigation pane by dragging the beige vertical line if you cannot see the full titles in the list.

The default display sorts the results in alphabetical order.

You can click the Sort button to change the display order to sort by Name or by the Modified date
You can use the breadcrumbs to navigate up the folder hierarchy, click on the Folder button to jump to a specific level, or click the Previous button to navigate up
Click Team content icon to close it or any other icon to navigate away from the current view.
Now let’s take a closer look at the Cognos search function.

You can find reports in Cognos by searching with keywords or by browsing the folders.

Click the magnifying glass icon to enable the search panel.

Enter a keyword in the search field.

When typing in the Search field, Cognos displays a dynamic list of objects that have the keyword in the title of your search.
You can pick an object from the list or press Enter to complete the search.

Note that your results display different icons at the left.

This icon represents a report, while this one indicates that it is a shortcut to the report.

You can view a list of icons used throughout Cognos by clicking the onscreen link. The PDF is also available under the resources link at the top of the player.

Click to continue.

If the search returns a large list of search Results, then you can filter the results by

clicking the filter icon, which looks like a funnel.

The filter panel opens up, and you can filter by type, such as reports,dashboards, data and folders.

Or, by date modified. Your choices are all, today, yesterday, past week and past month.
Click the clear all link to deselect all filters.

Users can save search criteria for future use by clicking the Save Search button.

After you save a search, a confirmation message will appear on the screen.

The next time you go to Search, your saved item will display on the search screen under the title Saved Searches.
If you want to remove an item from your saved searches, hover over the icon to enable an X button. Click the X to remove the item.
To run a report, start by click the team content folder.

For this example,we will run the Leave Accrual and Balances Summary Report.

This report lives in the Absence Management sub-folder .

After you click on the report name, the prompts page opens up.

Here you can define the specifications of your report by selecting filters on each prompt box.

Observe that for some prompt boxes a selection is required, as indicated on the box header.

You will see the word required with an asterisk for any prompt you must fill in before continuing.

When you are selecting the items within a given prompt box, you can select or deselect all filters.

You can also select items from the list by control-click on each individual item they wish to select.
If you would like to clear all selections, and start over, choose the link at the bottom of the screen called “clear all selections”.

The Submit button will be grayed out until you select a criteria for all of the required fields.

In this example, now that all the report parameters have been entered,we can proceed by clicking the submit button.
The system will then display a message like the one on the screen while running the report.

Here is the report.

Let’s take a look at the options we have on this screen.

Keep in mind that the report is going to display 25 data rows at a time.

To view more data, scroll down the page and use the navigation links to load more results.

The Bottom link takes the user to the last page of the report.

Notice the save icon at the top of the screen.

When you click it, the “Save report as report view” is displayed.
Click it to display a dialog box.

Here you can rename the report, and choose the location where you would like to save it within the Cognos system.

The report will be saved to the My Content folder.

Click OK when you are done.
The run button provides with different options for the types of outputs for your report.

The default output format is HTML, which is the web version you see on screen.

You can also send the report to a file in Excel, CSV or PDF formats.
If you wish to print the report, first save it as a PDF, and then use the print function on the PDF file.

The Excel and Excel data option both provide your report for viewing in Excel.

However the Excel data version will normalize the data so that information displayed in chart view will instead be displayed in one row.

This makes it easier to analyze and filter your results in Excel.
If you wish to re-run the report, this option takes you to the prompt page where you can reconfigure the prompts to run the report again.
The “more” menu enable when you click the dot dot dot icon at the top of the screen provides a few more options.

You can set a report as home, meaning that the report will display on your homepage as soon as you enter the Cognos system.

This is great when there is a report that you frequently run.

Share provides a link to the report which you can send to other Cognos users.

Their ability to see this report will depend on their security access to the Cognos system.
The embed function provides code to display the report on a webpage.

And subscribe allows you to schedule how often you would like the system to send you the report. for example, you could subscribe to a report that you run every week,and you will receive an email with a notification for that report.

This concludes the Cognos Interface Walkthrough module.

Please click to continue.

Thank you for watching the Cognos Reporting training module.

Please click on the Recourses link to download a copy of the quick reference guide of Cognos.

Visit the UC Davis UC Path website for more training resources and job aids.

If you have questions or suggestions, please drop us an email at ucpath@ucdavis.edu.

Click next to close the course.
